intro: Hieracium urusianum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, forming dense clusters at the top of the stems. Hieracium urusianum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
